alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 10 at 7:57PM MDT until April 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN EASTWARD DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Warm, dry, windy, and unstable conditions will persist areawide Monday. Very strong to potentially damaging wind gusts to around 65 mph are possible Tuesday along and just east of the central mountain chain, with critical fire weather developing along and east of the Middle Rio Grande Valley. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...All areas below any snowpack from early Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15% Monday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
